greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts of the form 3^a*5^b or 2.
link: Joseph Myers and Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000 (first 1000 terms from Joseph Myers)
British Mathematical Olympiad 2015/16, Olympiad Round 1, Problem 6, Friday, 27 November 2015.
mathematica: nmax = 100; A003593 = Select[Range[nmax], PowerMod[15, #, #] == 0 &]; CoefficientList[Series[(1 + x^2) * Product[(1 + x^(A003593[[k]])), {k, 1, Length[A003593]}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Dec 18 2015 *)
program: f u vs ws'@(w:ws) | u < w = (p' vs u) : f (u + 1) vs ws'
p (k:ks) m = if m < k then 0 else p' ks (m - k) + p' ks m
results.author: _Joseph Myers_, Nov 29 2015
